TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HotSpotCollection extends System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection
Public NotInheritable Class HotSpotCollection Inherits StateManagedCollection
public ref class HotSpotCollection sealed : System::Web::UI::StateManagedCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects inside an control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> class represents a collection that enables an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control to maintain a list of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects it contains.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method to add a specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at the end of an ordinal index array. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at a specified index location. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object in the collection at a specified index, using simple array notation.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the end of the collection. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from a specified index location.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpots%2A> property is used to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.Cstr/CS/imagemap.cstrcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.Cstr/VB/imagemap.cstrvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks When overridden in a derived class, this constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot.%23ctor%2A> constructor to programmatically create two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects and add them to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.Cstr/CS/imagemap.cstrcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.Cstr/VB/imagemap.cstrvb.aspx#1)]

Public Function Add (spot As HotSpot) As Integer

Docs.param: The object to append to the collection.
Docs.summary: Appends a specified object to the end of the collection.
Docs.returns: The index at which the object was added to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method adds the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the end of the collection. To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpots%2A> property is used to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.Cstr/CS/imagemap.cstrcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.Cstr/VB/imagemap.cstrvb.aspx#1)]

The object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts a specified object into the collection at the specified index location.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method adds the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at the specified index location. To append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the end of the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpots%2A> property is used to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method adds `Circle2` to the collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method adds `Circle1` to the collection at the first element, in front of `Circle2`. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HotSpotCollection.Insert#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.Insert/CS/hotspotcollection.insertcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HotSpotCollection.Insert#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.Insert/VB/hotspotcollection.insertvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.param: The ordinal index value that specifies the location of the object in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the object at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: The object at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object in the collection at the specified index, using array notation. The indexer allows you to modify or replace a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object in the collection directly.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Item%2A> property to directly access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection and display the value of each object's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.AlternateText%2A> property in a label on the page. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HotSpotCollection.Item#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.Item/CS/hotspotcollection.itemcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HotSpotCollection.Item#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.Item/VB/hotspotcollection.itemvb.aspx#1)]

.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Remove%2A> method removes the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the collection. To remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the collection at a specified index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. After the two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects are added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Remove%2A> method is used to delete `Circle1` from the collection. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HotSpotCollection.Remove#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.Remove/CS/hotspotcollection.removecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HotSpotCollection.Remove#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.Remove/VB/hotspotcollection.removevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The array index from which to remove the object.
Docs.summary: Removes the object at the specified index location from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method removes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object at the specified index location from the collection. To remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the collection by name, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. After the two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects are added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method is used to delete the object located at the first index in the collection. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt/CS/hotspotcollection.removeatcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt/VB/hotspotcollection.removeatvb.aspx#1)]
